CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 11, 1969, pg. 6 reads: "Baptism In River - The Rev. James M. Allen, vested pastor of Calvary Baptist Church, 2629 Wylie Ave., climaxed the "Old Fashioned" Revival Meeting, which he conducted at his church recently, by having baptismal rites in Allegheny River, following the pattern of the yesteryears. Pastor Allen is seen as he immersed the unidentified candidate.  He is assisted on the left by Deacon Henry Robinson, while Deacon Clinton Robinson, chairman of the board, stands by at the left. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Four men, left to right; unknown, Deacon Clinton Robinson, Deacon Henry Robinson, and Reverend James M. Allen, standing in Allegheny river for Calvary Baptist Church baptism
